instructions: Click the Digital Crown to bring up the apps on your Apple Watch. If you re using List View , you ll see a list instead of a grid. Find the app you want to delete. You can swipe around the face itself with a finger or turn the Digital Crown to shrink or enlarge the app icons. If you re in List View , simply scroll up and down the list to find the app you want to delete. Once you can see the app you re deleting, tap and hold its icon (or its name in List View ) until it starts to wiggle and you see a big X in the upper left-hand corner of the icon. This will look familiar if you ve deleted apps from your iPhone or iPad before. Tap the X to delete the app, then confirm the action with a tap on the Delete App button.

Launch the Watch app on your iPhone. Scroll down past the Apple-supplied apps to the third-party apps section. Tap an app you want to delete. Toggle the Show App on Apple Watch switch to Gray/White. A little message will appear underneath saying Uninstalling . When the message disappears, the app is deleted from your Apple Watch. If you want to put the app back on your Apple Watch, simply return to the Watch app, scroll past the apps that are already on your watch to the Available Apps section. Tap the Install button to the right of the app you want to reinstall on your Apple Watch. Wait for the familiar circle around a square icon to finish spinning. If you change your mind while reinstalling, simply tap the square to stop the reinstall.

Launch the Watch app on your iPhone. Make sure the My Watch tab is selected at the bottom left. Tap General to go to the settings you need. Tap the toggle switch to the right of Automatic App Install to turn it off. The green button will turn to gray/white.
